publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1210 Nanette Milne: Lift the Ban on Haggis Imports to the United States—That the Parliament notes with regret the continued ban on haggis imports to the United States of America; recognises that expatriate Scots are currently unable to enjoy their native dish; further notes that the US represents a major potential market for Scottish-produced haggis, and calls on the Scottish Government to make representations to the US Government to ensure that the ban is lifted by next Burns Night.

S3M-1210 Lift the Ban on Haggis Imports to the United States (lodged on 23 January 2008) Jamie McGrigor*, Elizabeth Smith*, John Lamont*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Kidd*, Bill Aitken*, Mary Scanlon*, Murdo Fraser*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Rob Gibson*, Brian Adam*, Mike Pringle*, Jim Tolson*, Ian McKee*, Jackson Carlaw*, Elaine Smith*

S3M-1210 Nanette Milne: Lift the Ban on Haggis Imports to the United States—That the Parliament notes with regret the continued ban on haggis imports to the United States of America; recognises that expatriate Scots are currently unable to enjoy their native dish; further notes that the US represents a major potential market for Scottish-produced haggis, and calls on the Scottish Government to make representations to the US Government to ensure that the ban is lifted by next Burns Night. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor, Elizabeth Smith, John Lamont, Kenneth Gibson, Bill Kidd, Bill Aitken, Mary Scanlon, Murdo Fraser, Hugh O’Donnell, Rob Gibson, Brian Adam, Mike Pringle, Jim Tolson, Ian McKee, Jackson Carlaw, Elaine Smith, Margaret Mitchell*, Joe FitzPatrick*
S3M-1210 Lift the Ban on Haggis Imports to the United States (lodged on 23 January 2008) Angela Constance*, Christine Grahame*, Karen Gillon*
S3M-1210 Lift the Ban on Haggis Imports to the United States (lodged on 23 January 2008) Gil Paterson*
